comment: TAKE HER!! Absolutely loved the biweekly structure of the class with its discussion posts and quizzes. No need buying the textbook. Final is optional.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: She was a good professor. 7 discussion post and 7 quizzes final exam was optional. The discussion post were very easy and very straight forward, give an abundance of time to complete the discussion post and quiz. take her if you need an easy A!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: I took a seven week course and was worried about having a ton of homework. But this was the easiest class ever. Grading only consisted of one quiz and one discussion post a week literally only takes 20 minutes. She's also very kind and really cares about her students. I enjoyed her discussion post topics.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: VERY easy class highly recommend to get the credit out of the way. Readings are posted so textbook is completely unnecessary. Weekly quiz and discussion posts. Quizzes are very easy, discussion posts due Sunday at 11:59 and 2 peer responses due after that on Tuesday at 11:59. Final is optional if you need it to improve your grade in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Teacher. Took this class as a 7 week course. Every week you 3 articles and then do a discussion and quiz, very easy work. Paid almost $50 for a book I looked at one time. Final Exam at the end of the semester, she made it optional. Easy class, light work, TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HER!!!! Literally an easy A class. Her class is set up in a biweekly system, so you have 2 weeks to finish a quiz, discussion post, and 2 replies (the minimum word count for both is 200). She assigns a textbook you need to buy but you don't need it since she provides samples on them and her final is optional!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: I took love and sex fully online and it was so easy! every two weeks you have a discussion post, quiz, and 2 peer responses due. YOU DO NOT NEED THE TEXTBOOK. The final is optional and is open note along with all the quizzes. It was an interesting and easy-going class I got a 99.7 even with getting 80s on quizzes and missing peer responses. TAKE
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I have an actual 100 in her class and all that proves is how EASY her class is. PLEASE TAKE HER! You won't regret it at all. Her discussion posts and quizzes (open note) are biweekly!! You have plenty time to do each post and two replies. The final is optional if you're content with your grade after the last discussion. 10/10 she's amazing.
Quiz and discussion post with 2 responses every other week. Super easy and probably spend 1 hour> every 2 weeks.

Take this professor! She makes the class so easy!! Assignments are bi-weekly, one discussion post and two responses and one quiz. Honestly, don't buy the textbook or read the lectures. I looked at the lectures while completing my assignments and finished with an A. The final is optional.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Easiest class ever, cannot recommend it enough. A quiz and discussion post biweekly, very easy. Interesting readings. Gives lots of extra credit if needed. Final is optional. There should be no excuse for not ending with a 100 if you do the work when it is due. Loved this class and perfect if you need a class for credits.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: GWST3030 (Gender in Pop Culture) - wasn't given the option when rating. She does zero lectures, so I felt like there was no actual teacher, but overall it was a relatively easy class. She gave very little feedback and it took her quite some time to grade anything. You work on one project/academic paper all semester on top of biweekly assignments.
rating_tags: So many papers

comment: all you do is quizzes and discussion. final is optional and there is 25 extra credit points available. she never answered my emails but this class is VERY simple and easy. I also never purchased the 50$ text book and still got an A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: PROTIP: the textbook is a compilation of essays. 99% of these essays can be found online in pdf form, so dont bother purchasing the textbook. Just look up a pdf whatever you're reading for the week. Tbh got away with just listening to the online lectures, didn't really read much, just CTRL+F for quizzes (open book).
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: The online course was very well-structured - every module was due biweekly and was laid out clearly. The textbook was super interesting and the lectures were a great summation of the content! She also gives a few opportunities for extra credit that are definitely worth it. Final exam is optional!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Online Savvy

comment: this professor is so nice & doesnt ask for much except for a quiz and discussion board every other week! this class is so easy, she even gives extra credit if you need it! she has a podcast of her reading the material too! she grades based on three things: quizzes, discussion posts, & replying to two peers per discussion post questions (easy A)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is amazing. She keeps the information diverse. The course material is audio, and written lectures, as well as YouTube videos and textbook readings. The grades are made up of bi-weekly discussions and quizzes that are easy as long as you pay attention to the lectures. 10/10 would take again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor does a great job at keeping the course material diverse. The course is made up of written lectures, textbook readings, audio lectures, and YouTube videos. The grades are based off of bi-weekly discussions and quizzes. They can be difficult if you don't read, but as long as you open the textbook you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Do yourself a favor, if you need to get this class for the credit hours and you dont want an assignment heavy class, take this professor! It consists of a discussion post and a quiz and you have 2 weeks to do it. Buying the textbook is very important! If you skim through the E-lectures and read the book youre guaranteed an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Online Savvy

comment: Very generous time period for each assignment, given 2 weeks per section and allows you open book for the quizzes makes it nearly impossible to get lower than an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly, not bad at all. Not much interaction with prof, but she makes the reading very easy to comprehend. Quizzes are super easy if you look at the reading at all (readings easy) and made final optional. Wants students to pass, just do the discussions and readings. Pretty easy and I liked the reading comprehension support she provided
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: McFarland is a very sweet, understanding lady. I had her for her Love & Sex online class, and she gave plenty of extra credit opportunities throughout the semester and at the end of the term for people needing a grade boost, though her class wasn't very hard at all. Bi-weekly discussions & quizzes and optional final exam. Take her!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very easy class, assignments due every 2 weeks, all assignments open at the beginning of semester. It is optional to take the final. If you do the work, you will get an A, even if it isnt good work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Professor McFarland is super easy to work with and her class is easy as well. I do not have anything negative to say about her or her teaching style. She is an easy grader. Just do your work and you should get an A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Honestly the blandness of this class resulted in me receiving a B. I honestly could have passed with a 100 if my procrastination bc of how boring it was did not get the best of me. The class is very easy but she does not let you make up any assignments. 1 quiz and 1 discussion post a week and then a final! Take her if you want an easy stress free A
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: This class was such an easy A, we had 8 quizzes and discussion posts and one final. She was an easy grader and we had two weeks to do each quiz+ discussion post! Take her !!! Requires some light reading but thats it!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class was an easy elective. two worksheets a week (later on throughout the semester she cuts it down to just one worksheet) a discussion every other week. The only test in the class is a final and its open note, i got an A on it. Easiest class ever.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: There is a lot of busy work in this class and it can be unnecessarily time consuming. She isn't very efficient in grading and it takes a while to get any feedback. Most of the reading is unnecessary, considering most of it is repetitive and she only asks one question about a 50 page reading. Not a hard class just time consuming for an elective.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took her during the Fall so this is only effective if you took it in person. I think she is great, yes there is a lot of work. Read multiple chapters for each weeks, read books, discussions lengthy and require you to think. But if you actually try to enjoy the class, it wouldn't be so bad. You'll learn a lot and her materials are interesting too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Professor McFarland is a great professor but this class has a lot of busy work. There are weekly assignments and quizzes and you have to do all of the readings in order to make an A in the class. If you do everything, it is an easy A, but be prepared to put some time in.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Im on the fence about this professor. By far the most work I had for a class even though it was non major related. At first she was very brutal about the very lengthy discussions you have to do bi-weekly, but she stopped grading for 2 months and started to hand out 100s. A lot of busy work, a lot of reading
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: This professor online for an elective gives out a lot of work. Every other week has a 350-word minimum discussion post with another 2 replies for full credit. Quizzes every week on top of that, sometimes having free-response questions. Not TOO difficult just extremely annoying for an elective class. With effort, it's not too hard to get an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Worst teacher! Pls do a favor to ur GPA and dont take her. She never replies to our email n so much reading just for a frikkin elective class. wish I had taken negative comments seriously n dropped her class. grades very hard and uses textbook heavily. Worst professor I have ever taken, and i regret it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Shes a great professor but I just wouldnt recommend her for an online class. Its A LOT OF WORK. You have to purchase movies and books and youre not given much time to read them. Its honestly easy but its a lot for an elective.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Professor McFarland seems great. Her class is composed of a crap ton of discussion posts, 10 quizzes, and lots of reading. The main book for the class is actually pretty interesting if you read it. Her quizzes are so easy, if you read the chapters & listened to the podcasts. If you stay on top of the work and read, you'll do great in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Her class isnt hard but it is ALOT OF WORK, mainly readings. She gives out nice grades for the discussion post but the quizzes are hard if you dont read the book or her lectures. Quizzes are written and multiple choice. I suggest taking this class in person but you can succeed in this class online, just have good time management skills
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Thought this class would have been an easy A but I was wrong. She wasn't an awful professor but the class wasn't that easy. Each week there was a 300 word discussion post due and a 5 question quiz. The quizzes were impossible to make a good grade on. Gives out 100's like candy on discussion post thought so it balances out. No test only the final
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I would not recommend this professor to my worst enemy. A 300 word discussion post and 5 question quiz every week. Assigns multiple (long) chapters to read weekly along with movies you must purchase independently. The amount of work this lady assigns is absolutely ridiculous for a gen ed class. She acts as if that's the only class students have.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Overall, not a bad class. The class is made up of quizzes and discussion posts each week. The discussion posts are easy but the quizzes are pretty hard. They are both based on the textbook so I prefer getting it online to navigate it easier. The quizzes are only ever 5 questions. The final was not bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor McFarland takes this class very seriously, so if you dont she will know. There are quizzes from a very weird novel every week that are impossible to find online, but in class you just watch movies. Its an easy A besides the quizzes.. so I recommend getting an online version you can control f with to find answers! No tests though!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her class is so easy. As long as you do all the readings and partipate in discussions, its an easy A. All of the graded assignments are on d2l and theyre mostly discussion posts and 5 question quizzes over the readings. I took her class bc I needed a humanities course and Im so glad I chose GWST over Spanish lol
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: very open minded and has only a couple novels you need for the class she takes attenedence for a grade and always responds back to emails as quick as possible
A lot of textbook readings and two books that are also required to read. Honestly I did not read a single page and made an A in this class. Take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: ABSOLUTELY LOVE HER!! She's brilliant. Do yourself a favor and take her.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: All i can say is i freaking love her. Seriously the best teacher. Shes friendly,nice, inspirational, just an amazing person. Discussion in her class was non judgmental and open to anything. I wish i could take her for more classes. I hope she continues to inspire other students as she has me.

By far one of my favorite professors that I've ever had! I had quite a few health related issues this semester, and she was more than understanding about it. You can tell she really cares about her students. You can tell where her opinions stand on multiple issues, but she is very open to understanding other points of view. I would take her again!!

Love Professor McFarland! You get 2 free discussions posts that you can miss, you get 4 free absences! NO tests, just D2L posts about once a week. Two papers and a final project. This class taught me so much! Professor McFarland has a joyful spirit and is very kind. I would take her again!
